| HistoryText             = These "X-Men" were five young and rich people from [[San Francisco]] who wanted to be heroes. Passing through a selection process operated by [[Lobe (Earth-616)|Lobe]]'s society, Sublime, they were chosen from among two thousands participants, and were each given the powers of one of the five original [[X-Men (Earth-616)|X-Men]]: [[Henry McCoy (Earth-616)|Beast]], [[Scott Summers (Earth-616)|Cyclops]], [[Jean Grey (Earth-616)|Marvel Girl]], [[Robert Drake (Earth-616)|Iceman]], and [[Warren Worthington III (Earth-616)|Angel]].{{r|Uncanny X-Men Vol 1 530}}

The "X-Men" were sent into town, operating as costumed heroes, as a promotion for Sublime products, proving themselves to be messy and unorganized heroes.{{r|Uncanny X-Men Vol 1 531}}

When the true X-Men were battling the [[Han, Chang, Lin, Sun, and Ho Tao-Yu (Earth-616)|Collective Man]], those impersonators came, intending to help their idols, but were soon knocked out by the Chinese mutant. The five of them were sent to the [[X-Brig]] of [[Utopia (X-Men Base)|Utopia]], and interrogated by the adamantium-poisoned [[James Howlett (Earth-616)|Wolverine]].{{r|Uncanny X-Men Vol 1 532}}

After the attack on Sublime Corporation's inauguration of the Xperience, the "New X-Men" apologized, except for [[Penny Newsom (Earth-616)|Penny Newsom]] who left without being noticed by anybody, with two inhalers, containing [[Emma Frost (Earth-616)|Emma Frost]]'s and [[Jean Grey (Earth-616)|Jean Grey]]'s powers.{{r|Uncanny X-Men Vol 1 534}}

| Equipment               = [[Ruby-Quartz]]'s visor for [[Cyclops (Lobe) (Earth-616)|"Cyclops"]], [[Xperience]]'s inhalants.
| Transportation          = [[Penny Newsom (Earth-616)|"Angel"]] 's flight, [[Marvel Girl (Lobe) (Earth-616)|"Marvel Girl"]] 's telekinesis
